meanings.definition: To tilt or turn up or to one side
meanings.sent1: She was cocking her head to the side to listen better.
meanings.sent2: He was cocking his hat at a jaunty angle.
meanings.sent3: The cat was cocking its tail in curiosity.
meanings.sent4: The tree was cocking its branches towards the sunlight.
meanings.sent5: The child was cocking his toy gun in preparation for play.

meanings.definition: To set the hammer of a firearm in a position ready for firing
meanings.sent1: The soldier was cocking his rifle before taking aim.
meanings.sent2: She was cocking the gun, getting ready for the shooting competition.
meanings.sent3: The detective was cocking his gun in the movie scene.
meanings.sent4: The cowboy was cocking his revolver before the duel.
meanings.sent5: The police officer was cocking his weapon for safety reasons.

meanings.definition: A male bird, especially a rooster
meanings.sent1: The farm had a proud cocking strutting around.
meanings.sent2: The cocking crowed loudly at dawn.
meanings.sent3: The cocking was the king of the coop.
meanings.sent4: The cocking's feathers were vibrant and colorful.
meanings.sent5: The cocking's call woke up the whole neighborhood.
